summary: The Train Noise and Vibrations Reduction Act of 2025 mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to produce a report with recommendations to reduce train noise and vibrations near homes. The report, due within a year of the Act's enactment, must include recommendations addressing various aspects, such as train and track modifications, speed limits, mitigation measures, distance requirements, operational limits, noise insulation, and soil condition modifications. The report will also feature cost-benefit estimates for all recommendations.
